title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: Thomas P. Jackson to Orlando Brown, October 31, 1867
summary: This report by Jackson primarily concerns the relations between whites and blacks and political attitudes in Augusta County following an election. Jackson also notes the connection between voting behavior and the willingness of employers to sign contracts.
keywords: Aid/Relief, Community Values/Local Behavior, Economy, Employment/Labor, Politics/Political Attitudes, Race Relations, American Civil War
